questions.question_text: A technician needs to harden all newly deployed network printers following a data breach. Which of the following should the technician do to BEST fulfill this need?

choices.C: Place all printers on a separate print server.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is the correct

D
Updating to the latest firmware is the most effective step to harden newly deployed printers, as it ensures they are protected against known vulnerabilities and exploits.

Selected Answer: D
It's D
Firmware updates are critical for network printer security. Manufacturers regularly release them to address security vulnerabilities discovered in the printer's operating system. These updates often patch bugs and improve the overall security posture of the device, making it more resistant to potential cyberattacks.

questions.question_text: A user working in the field reported the GPS stopped working on a phone. The user's older, in-car GPS continued to function. Later, the user reported that the phone's GPS started working again. Which of the following MOST likely caused the phone's GPS to fail?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. The cell phone had lost service to the carrier.

The most likely cause of the phone's GPS failure is B. The cell phone had lost service to the carrier.

Many modern smartphones use a combination of GPS, Wi-Fi, and cellular signals to determine location. If the phone loses cellular service, it may not be able to accurately determine its location, especially in areas with weak Wi-Fi signals.

Here's why the other options are less likely:

A. The cell phone was in conservation mode: While conservation mode can affect certain features, it's unlikely to completely disable GPS functionality.
C. The cell phone received a firmware update: Firmware updates typically improve device performance and stability. They are not likely to cause GPS failures.
D. The cell phone had overheated: Overheating can cause various issues, but it's less likely to specifically affect GPS functionality.
Therefore, a temporary loss of cellular service is the most probable explanation for the phone's GPS failure.

GG

Conservation mode (or battery saver mode) often limits or disables certain functions, including GPS, to preserve battery life. When the phone's GPS stopped working and later resumed, it is likely that the conservation mode was temporarily activated, causing the GPS feature to be disabled in favor of saving power.

Selected Answer: B
My phone did overheat once in the car, and its GPS did malfunction... More an issue with the phone than anything.
Still, the scenario's best answer is B.

comments.content: I've seen many top comments 'interpreting' what the question meant to say. Really not the best way to go about studying for an exam like this
you are saying not to assume, but then we should assume the cell phone lost service? lol

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
???

Why would you ASSUME that there was some kind of overheating issue?

Pro tip: With these tests, NEVER ASSUME anything. Go by what the questions literally state.

More than likely, the cell phone lost service is all.

Selected Answer: D
GPS signal comes from GPS satellites and cell towers only fine tune that. GPS would continue working but may not be pinpoint accurate. Not to mention the use of GPS on a phone can cause overheating. I am thinking the cell phone overheated since it mentioned the tech was working in the field and his in car GPS still worked. I go with D.

comments.content: If the phone was overheating, other applications would not be working, including the phone shutting off intermittently. It wouldn't just affect the GPS

GPS signal comes from GPS satellites and cell towers only fine tune that. GPS would continue working but may not be pinpoint accurate. I am thinking the cell phone overheated since it mentioned the tech was working in the field and his in car GPS still worked. I go with D.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
This indicates that the tracker is currently unable to show you real-time, accurate positions. The tracker may be switched off or the battery may be empty. It could also be because the tracker is struggling to maintain a connection to local cell networks, or unable to detect accurate GPS positions.

choices.B: The cell phone had lost service to the carrier.
choices.C: The cell phone received a firmware update.
choices.A: The cell phone was in conservation mode.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is the most likely answer. 

A) The docking station is improperly installed.
This can make the laptop sit uneven but it shouldn't make the laptop hot.

B) The hard drive is disconnected 
This would make the laptop not boot because of missing drive.
This will also not make the laptop run hot 

C) The CPU fan is too powerful 
 The user must have installed some drone propellers to make it fly (not sit leveled)
When cpu fan is blowing hard, it is mostly that the cpu is running hot and the fan is trying to cool down the temperature of the CPU. Or can be a fault issue and it is a sign to replace the laptop fan (clicking noises). 

D)The battery is damage
This make the laptop uneven due to swollen battery. User might have improper power management on the laptop. Can be a cause of overcharging which can decrease the life of the battery. 
So D is the likely answer
I think because the battery is swollen the laptop is not level with the surface. Swollen battery might also cause it to become hot.I would guess D.

comments.content: What about the fact that the user reported the laptop is too hot? How does a docking station cause that? Hot laptop, can't sit level points to a swollen battery so D. The battery is damaged is correct.

discussion.content:
A. The docking station is improperly installed.

If the laptop is unable to sit level on the workspace and is uneven, it suggests that it may be docked or connected to a docking station, and the docking station is not properly aligned or connected. Docking stations are designed to provide additional connectivity and features to laptops but must be properly installed for the laptop to sit level and function correctly.

Options B, C, and D do not directly address the issue of the laptop not sitting level due to an improper docking station installation.

choices.C: The CPU fan is too powerful.
choices.A: The docking station is improperly installed.

questions.question_text: A technician responds to a user who has reported that a laptop is too hot. The technician notices the laptop is not able to sit level on the workspace. Which of the following BEST describes the issue with the laptop?
A user's laptop is experiencing severe slowdowns when operating process-intensive tasks. Which of the following memory upgrades is compatible with a laptop?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
SODIMM because it's SO DIMM small!

The correct answer is D. SODIMM.

SODIMM (Small Outline DIMM) is a type of memory module designed for laptops and other small form factor devices. It's the most common type of RAM used in laptops.

Here's why the other options are incorrect:

A. DIMM: DIMMs are larger memory modules typically used in desktop computers. They are not compatible with laptop motherboards.
B. ECC RAM: ECC RAM is primarily used in servers and other high-performance systems to detect and correct errors in memory. While it can be used in some high-end laptops, it's not the most common type.
C. Virtual RAM: Virtual RAM, also known as swap memory, is a software-based solution that uses hard disk space to simulate additional RAM. While it can help improve performance in some cases, it's not a substitute for physical RAM upgrades.
Therefore, upgrading to SODIMM modules is the most appropriate solution for improving the laptop's performance.

GG

Selected Answer: D
SODIMM is the type of RAM memory made for laptops. The DIMM memory (Single in-line memory module) is made for desktops and the modules are almost twice as long (133mm) as those for laptops (67mm).

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The most likely cause of the solid black line appearing on all copies produced on the copier (but not affecting printing) is a scratch on the scanning bed. The scanning bed is the glass surface on which the original document is placed for scanning. If there is a scratch on the scanning bed, the light sensor or scanning element may be unable to differentiate between the scratched area and the rest of the document, resulting in a solid black line being copied onto every page.

choices.B: A scratch on the scanning bed

questions.question_text: Users report that all copies produced on a copier have a solid black line, but printing is unaffected. Which of the following is the MOST likely cause?
